org.gearvrf

Class GVRRenderData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRRenderData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class GVRRenderData
extends GVRHybridObject
    One of the key GVRF classes: Encapsulates the data associated with rendering a mesh. This includes the mesh itself, the mesh's material, camera association, rendering order, and various other parameters.

      • getMesh

        public GVRMesh getMesh()
        Returns:
        The mesh being rendered.

      • setMesh

        public void setMesh(GVRMesh mesh)
        Set the mesh to be rendered.
        Parameters:
        mesh - The mesh to be rendered.

      • setMesh

        public void setMesh(java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRMesh> mesh)
        Asynchronously set the mesh to be rendered. Uses a background thread from the thread pool to wait for the Future.get() method; unless you are loading dozens of meshes asynchronously, the extra overhead should be modest compared to the cost of loading a mesh.
        Parameters:
        mesh - The mesh to be rendered.
        Since:
        1.6.7

      • getMeshEyePointee

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<GVREyePointee> getMeshEyePointee()
        Return a Future<GVREyePointee> or null. If you use setMesh(Future), trying to create a GVRMeshEyePointee in the 'normal' (synchronous) way will fail, because this GVRRenderData won't have a mesh yet. This method prevents that problem by returning an Future tied to the current mesh status:
        • If you have already set a mesh, you will get a Future with get() methods that return immediately.
        • If you are currently waiting on a Future<GVRMesh>, you will get a 'true' Future that waits for the Future<GVRMesh>.
        • If you have neither, you will get null.
        Returns:
        Either a Future<GVREyePointee> or null.

      • getOffsetFactor

        public float getOffsetFactor()
        Returns:
        The factor value passed to glPolygonOffset() if GL_POLYGON_OFFSET_FILL is enabled.
        See Also:
        setOffset(boolean)

      • setOffsetFactor

        public void setOffsetFactor(float offsetFactor)
        Set the factor value passed to glPolygonOffset() if GL_POLYGON_OFFSET_FILL is enabled.
        Parameters:
        offsetFactor - Per OpenGL docs: Specifies a scale factor that is used to create a variable depth offset for each polygon. The initial value is 0.
        See Also:
        setOffset(boolean)

      • getOffsetUnits

        public float getOffsetUnits()
        Returns:
        The units value passed to glPolygonOffset() if GL_POLYGON_OFFSET_FILL is enabled.
        See Also:
        setOffset(boolean)

      • setOffsetUnits

        public void setOffsetUnits(float offsetUnits)
        Set the units value passed to glPolygonOffset() if GL_POLYGON_OFFSET_FILL is enabled.
        Parameters:
        offsetUnits - Per OpenGL docs: Is multiplied by an implementation-specific value to create a constant depth offset. The initial value is 0.
        See Also:
        setOffset(boolean)
